result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lee Will Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Lee Will Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 4:18 PM: Defendant Daniel Lee Will in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Joint recommendation.  Def and SPD confirm State's recital.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 :  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by SPD - argues for possibility of early termination after 9-12 mos.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  S/W - 18 mos probation .  Def may petition for early term at any time after completion of 1 yr if request is joined by supervising agent.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate;  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No DNA Sample however Surcharge ordered by the Court. After work tomorrow Def must contact DOC and determine which office he must report to due to his residence in Winnebago and working at Alliance in Ripon.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

2:27 pm case called. Defendant Daniel Lee Will in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion to dismiss the criminal complaint filed by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding merits of case to support amendment of matter and moves to amend charge. Attorney Szilagyi formally moves to withdraw the motion filed in June and defendant will agree to amendment of charges and requests a plea/sentencing hearing on a separate date. Amended Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters a plea of Not Guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
by USPS - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward
Motion hearing on August 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests motion hearing be set.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss the Criminal Complaint
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 09:35 am.

Case Called @ 1:16 PM: Defendant Daniel Lee Will in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed today.  INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted and Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 09:35 am.
Initial appearance on May 24, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Daniel Lee Will in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corporation Counsel also present in Court as to unpaid financial obligations.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  SPD will require attachment referenced in the Complaint.  Per SPD:  Eligibility Confirmed.  Def to serve sentence of 4 mos from 14CF-27.  ADA argues for Signature Bond w/no conditions.  No objections by SPD.  Previous Riverside Ruling re-affirmed.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  As to Unpaid Fines:  Court finds basis for contempt - 60 days WCJ consecutive to any sentence that may be served - Stayed  - Purge:  8/1/2016 and continuing without interruption maintaint a $200 monthly payment the Defendant has agreed to.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
